title.narrative: Emergency Social Stabilization and Resilience Project (ESSRP)

description.narrative: With the liberation of areas from ISIS control, it is imperative for the Government of Iraq to quickly move back into these areas in order to provide support on the human aspects of the stabilization efforts, with a view towards individual and community recovery. As such, emphasis is needed on support to returnees including the provision of cash, short-term employment, and other means of social support to the most vulnerable of these returnees. The project provides cash-for-work and livelihood opportunities to returning and existing populations in the liberated areas, as well as addressing the impact of conflict on the population by strengthening social safety net function at the Ministry of Labour and Social Affairs. The aim is to encourage stabilization and recovery efforts for those communities and to help kick?start economic activity, employment opportunities, and livelihoods. The project also provides services to mitigate psychosocial impacts of the conflict. Furthermore, it supports the establishment of a resilient social safety net system, including development of a robust social registry, strengthening social workers' infrastructure, and scaling up the existing conditional cash transfers as mitigation measures.

participating-org.narrative: Iraq - Ministry of Labor & Social Affairs

sector.narrative: Movement, Emergency and Post-Crisis Migration Management
Multisector aid for basic social services

policy-marker.narrative: Project with some but insufficient inclusion of gender issues

provider-org.narrative: Iraq - Ministry of Labor & Social Affairs
